text: I respect the astute and rigorously unsentimental David Horowitz as one of America's most original and courageous political analysts. He has the true 1960s spirit - audacious and irreverent, yet passionately engaged and committed to social change.
author: Camille Paglia

text: As man sows, so shall he reap. In works of fiction, such men are sometimes converted. More often, in real life, they do not change their natures until they are converted into dust.
author: Charles W. Chesnutt

text: To improve is to change to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

text: For changes to be of any true value, they've got to be lasting and consistent.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Man has a limited biological capacity for change. When this capacity is overwhelmed, the capacity is in future shock.
author: Alvin Toffler

text: Men may change their climate, but they cannot change their nature. A man that goes out a fool cannot ride or sail himself into common sense.
author: Joseph Addison

text: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.
author: Hugh Prather

text: There are many things we do not want about the world. Let us not just mourn them. Let us change them.
author: Ferdinand Marcos

text: A dog that has rabies probably will do things it wouldn't do if it didn't have rabies. But that doesn't change the fact that it has rabies.
author: John Malkovich

text: I think if there's something one needs to change with oneself, it doesn't have to happen in the New Year. You can do that any time you please - not that it's not a good inspirational tactic for the people that it works for.
author: Brittany Murphy

text: The Howard Hughes I knew began to change after his plane crash in 1941.
author: Gene Tierney

text: All change is not growth, as all movement is not forward.
author: Ellen Glasgow

text: For time and the world do not stand still. Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or the present are certain to miss the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: I think it's harder for people than it should be. But as more and more of us become carbon neutral and change the patterns in our lives to be part of the solution instead of part of the problem, we are now beginning to see the changes in policy that are needed.
author: Al Gore

text: Vengeance is not the point change is. But the trouble is that in most people's minds the thought of victory and the thought of punishing the enemy coincide.
author: Barbara Deming

text: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
author: Carl Rogers

text: Those people in New York are not gonna change me none.
author: Elvis Presley

text: We have to do more than just elect a new President if we truly want to change this country.
author: Dan Quayle

text: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: True change takes place in the imagination.
author: Thomas Moore

text: I was advised by an American agent when I was about 19 to change my surname.
author: Rachel Weisz

text: Celebrity culture has gone crazy, and I think the reason is that real news is just not bearable, and it also seems impossible to change anything.
author: Chris Martin

text: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Only in growth, reform, and change, paradoxically enough, is true security to be found.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

text: Change means that what was before wasn't perfect. People want things to be better.
author: Esther Dyson

text: Not only is women's work never done, the definition keeps changing.
author: Bill Copeland

text: Future shock is the shattering stress and disorientation that we induce in individuals by subjecting them to too much change in too short a time.
author: Alvin Toffler

text: We're not trying to change the world just music.
author: Jonathan Davis

text: Taste may change, but inclination never.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Those issues are biblical issues: to care for the sick, to feed the hungry, to stand up for the oppressed. I contend that if the evangelical community became more biblical, everything would change.
author: Tony Campolo

text: Unless there is meaningful change in Syria and an end to the crackdown, President Assad and those around him will find themselves isolated internationally and discredited within Syria.
author: William Hague

text: If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: It is often when night looks darkest, it is often before the fever breaks that one senses the gathering momentum for change, when one feels that resurrection of hope in the midst of despair and apathy.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: Perfection is immutable. But for things imperfect, change is the way to perfect them.
author: Owen Feltham

text: Ah! how annoying that the law doesn't allow a woman to change husbands just as one does shirts.
author: Moliere

text: The future is not Big Government. Self-serving politicians. Powerful bureaucrats. This has been tried, tested throughout history. The result has always been disaster. President Obama, your agenda is not new. It's not change, and it's not hope.
author: Rush Limbaugh

text: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod my shadow does that much better.
author: Plutarch

text: I'm not going to change the world overnight. It's one person at a time, and hopefully they're people in positions of power who can help people get in those roles and really, truly embrace colorblind casting.
author: Gabrielle Union

text: Negroes - Sweet and docile, Meek, humble, and kind: Beware the day - They change their mind.
author: Langston Hughes

text: Any change, even a change for the better, is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
author: Arnold Bennett

text: Swearing is industry language. For as long as we're alive it's not going to change. You've got to be boisterous to get results.
author: Gordon Ramsay

text: Let me be absolutely clear. Israel is a strong friend of Israel's. It will be a strong friend of Israel's under a McCain administration. It will be a strong friend of Israel's under an Obama administration. So that policy is not going to change.
author: Barack Obama

text: Even God cannot change the past.
author: Agathon

text: If a person doesn't change, there's something really wrong with him.
author: Clint Eastwood

text: We are all born with a unique genetic blueprint, which lays out the basic characteristics of our personality as well as our physical health and appearance... And yet, we all know that life experiences do change us.
author: Joan D. Vinge

text: Since we cannot change reality, let us change the eyes which see reality.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: If I can change than anyone can change. I promise you that.
author: Brett Favre

text: I don't write for any group. I write to bring about a change in consciousness.
author: Jeanette Winterson

text: Miracles happen everyday, change your perception of what a miracle is and you'll see them all around you.
author: Jon Bon Jovi

text: We can't change anything until we get some fresh ideas, until we begin to see things differently.
author: James Hillman

text: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Comedians walk out, get a feel for the crowd. If it's not going good, we change directions. If we got to drag your momma into this thing, we will. Whatever we got to do.
author: Steve Harvey

text: Sometimes I have these fantasies of just moving to a foreign country and coming back with a full head of hair. Or not even come back! Make a new life there with hair... Change my name, just see what happens.
author: Larry David

text: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils for time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

text: When fish experience something that would cause other animals physical pain, they behave in ways suggestive of pain, and the change in behaviour may last several hours.
author: Peter Singer

text: Any form of art is a form of power it has impact, it can affect change - it can not only move us, it makes us move.
author: Ossie Davis

text: When you look at all the miracles attributed to Jesus, they're all about change.
author: Michael Sheen

text: People can try to reinvent themselves. I don't think you can really change who you are, though, because who you are is pretty much where you came from and what you've done up to now.
author: Eminem

text: Never Have Your Dog Stuffed is really advice to myself, a reminder to myself not to avoid change or uncertainty, but to go with it, to surf into change.
author: Alan Alda

text: Change your opinions, keep to your principles change your leaves, keep intact your roots.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Change will never happen when people lack the ability and courage to see themselves for who they are.
author: Bryant H. McGill

text: I love what I do, and when I don't love what I do, I'll make a change.
author: Katy Perry

text: I'm a Gemini, so I change my mind every day.
author: Natalie Portman

text: We may think there is willpower involved, but more likely... change is due to want power. Wanting the new addiction more than the old one. Wanting the new me in preference to the person I am now.
author: George A. Sheehan

text: When I'm bored or tired of being blonde, I'll throw on a wig. It's a lot less of a permanent way to change your look, and I have about 10 - all different colors, shapes, bobs, long hair, short, feathered.
author: Sara Blakely

text: For a change, lady luck seemed to be smiling on me. Then again, maybe the fickle wench was just lulling me into a false sense of security while she reached for a rock.
author: Timothy Zahn

text: Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The only difference between me and others is that they think they can change something with cute little poems, nice cards or embracing trees and being nice to little lapdogs.
author: Henry Rollins

text: There is danger in reckless change, but greater danger in blind conservatism.
author: Henry George

text: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: It's coming home to roost over the next 50 years or so. It's not just climate change it's sheer space, places to grow food for this enormous horde. Either we limit our population growth or the natural world will do it for us, and the natural world is doing it for us right now.
author: David Attenborough

text: Life has got a habit of not standing hitched. You got to ride it like you find it. You got to change with it. If a day goes by that don't change some of your old notions for new ones, that is just about like trying to milk a dead cow.
author: Woody Guthrie

text: One must change one's tactics every ten years if one wishes to maintain one's superiority.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: Forgiving does not erase the bitter past. A healed memory is not a deleted memory. Instead, forgiving what we cannot forget creates a new way to remember. We change the memory of our past into a hope for our future.
author: Lewis B. Smedes

text: I'm definitely open to change, but at the same time I am quite stubborn.
author: Andy Murray

text: Becoming a mother cannot help but change things. An author's life is reflected in their writing, whether they want it to be or not, and parenthood is one of the biggest life changes there is.
author: Sarah Zettel

text: There can be no peace in the world so long as a large proportion of the population lack the necessities of life and believe that a change of the political and economic system will make them available. World peace must be based on world plenty.
author: John Boyd Orr

text: People's view of cancer will change when they have their own relationship with cancer, which everyone will, at some point.
author: Laura Linney

text: If you continually write and read yourself as a fiction, you can change what's crushing you.
author: Jeanette Winterson

text: The biggest danger to the European Union comes not from those who advocate change, but from those who denounce new thinking as heresy. In its long history Europe has experience of heretics who turned out to have a point.
author: David Cameron

text: Until we totally change the way we elect our leaders, until we remove private money from public campaigns, lying will be the de facto method of governance in this country.
author: Peter Schuyler

text: You are educated. Your certification is in your degree. You may think of it as the ticket to the good life. Let me ask you to think of an alternative. Think of it as your ticket to change the world.
author: Tom Brokaw

text: Nothing is as real as a dream. The world can change around you, but your dream will not. Responsibilities need not erase it. Duties need not obscure it. Because the dream is within you, no one can take it away.
author: Tom Clancy

text: People got insights into what was bothering them, but they hardly did a damn thing to change.
author: Albert Ellis

text: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
author: Flannery O'Connor

text: Girls are taught to sing high and pretty, like Antony, not low and from the guts like Nina Simone. But we're slowly trying to change that. There are so many things we're not told growing up, and it's our true feminist responsibility to take the truth to the people who need to hear it.
author: Beth Ditto

text: Don't fear change - embrace it.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

text: I cannot say whether things will get better if we change what I can say is they must change if they are to get better.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

text: The need for change bulldozed a road down the center of my mind.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If you don't change your beliefs, your life will be like this forever. Is that good news?
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: Yet what you need is not marches, demonstrations, rallies or wide associations, all of them are important. What you need is direct action. The sooner people understand that, the sooner we'll begin to change things.
author: Arthur Scargill

text: One of the most important things to remember about infant care is: don't change diapers in midstream.
author: Don Marquis

text: I'd be happy to be taken as a woman - and that's what I was initially trying to do when I started throwing on dresses and stuff. But that wasn't going to happen because everyone kept calling me sir. So I thought I'd change the method and just start wearing what I wanted to wear.
author: Eddie Izzard

text: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
author: Richard Bach

text: And Seaman, just like a falling oak, manages to change direction.
author: John Motson

text: I like change. There's something Buddhist about it - continuous change is wonderful.
author: David Bailey

text: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.
author: Harry S. Truman

text: An apology might help, but you can change your life without one.
author: Robin Quivers

text: Sadly, we do a much better job of making people feel guilty than we do of delivering them from the guilt we create. We need to confess this and change our ways.
author: Tony Campolo

text: No great movement designed to change the world can bear to be laughed at or belittled. Mockery is a rust that corrodes all it touches.
author: Milan Kundera

text: Time does not change us. It just unfolds us.
author: Max Frisch

text: Change is not only likely, it's inevitable.
author: Barbara Sher

text: Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape.
author: William S. Burroughs

text: I was born left-handed, but I was made to use my other hand. When I was writing 'Famished Road,' which was very long, I got repetitive stress syndrome. My right wrist collapsed, so I started using my left hand. The prose I wrote with my left hand came out denser, so later on I had to change it.
author: Ben Okri

text: I think having a child can really change you if you're open to it.
author: Tori Amos

text: Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.
author: Marge Piercy

text: A technical solution may be defined as one that requires a change only in the techniques of the natural sciences, demanding little or nothing in the way of change in human values or ideas of morality.
author: Garrett Hardin

text: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Few expected very much of Franklin Roosevelt on Inauguration Day in 1933. Like Barack Obama seventy-six years later, he was succeeding a failed Republican president, and Americans had voted for change. What that change might be Roosevelt never clearly said, probably because he himself didn't know.
author: Russell Baker

text: There are many challenges, there are many obstacles let us try to change the obstacles to advantages.
author: Harri Holkeri

text: We, the people. Manifest Destiny. Conceived in liberty. Fear itself. Ask not. Morning in America. United we stand. Yes, we can. In times of great change and tumult, presidents seek to inspire beleaguered Americans by reminding them of their national identity.
author: Ron Fournier

text: Change is inevitable. Change for the better is a full-time job.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

text: A liberal knows that the only certainty in this life is change but believes that the change can be directed toward a constructive end.
author: Henry A. Wallace

text: I used to be a Catholic. I left because I object to conversion by concussion. If you don't agree with what they teach, you get clobbered over the head until you do. All that does is change the shape of the head.
author: Alan Alda

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: I like to change characters and then, slowly I believe the audience treat me as, like an actor who can fight. It's not like an action star.
author: Jackie Chan

text: There is nothing permanent except change.
author: Heraclitus

text: Lord, where we are wrong, make us willing to change where we are right, make us easy to live with.
author: Peter Marshall

text: To be in a situation where you have no rights whatsoever is something I wish everybody could experience. People's attitudes would change. It would be a better place.
author: Tommy Chong

text: This life is a hospital in which every patient is possessed with a desire to change his bed.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: The pessimist complains about the wind the optimist expects it to change the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: There is at least one point in the history of any company when you have to change dramatically to rise to the next level of performance. Miss that moment - and you start to decline.
author: Andy Grove

text: My mom was always saying: 'Be whatever you want to be, but stick with it. Don't waver. Don't change who you are for anybody.'
author: Miranda Lambert

text: The more things change, the more they are the same.
author: Alphonse Karr

text: As I have said for many years throughout this land, we're borrowing money from China to buy oil from the Persian Gulf to burn it in ways that destroy the future of human civilization. Every bit of that has to change.
author: Al Gore

text: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: Maybe more climate activists will think about the climate change not as an international problem to be resolved in an air-conditioned meeting hall, but as a guerilla war to be fought in the streets.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: Illness strikes men when they are exposed to change.
author: Herodotus

text: When you're a catalyst for change, you make enemies - and I'm proud of the ones I've got.
author: Rupert Murdoch

text: Hip-hop is supposed to uplift and create, to educate people on a larger level and to make a change.
author: Doug E. Fresh

text: We are not victims of aging, sickness and death. These are part of scenery, not the seer, who is immune to any form of change. This seer is the spirit, the expression of eternal being.
author: Deepak Chopra

text: In order to effect great change, we need to look at how we can help those in our own communities as well as globally.
author: Christina Aguilera

text: Action and reaction, ebb and flow, trial and error, change - this is the rhythm of living. Out of our over-confidence, fear out of our fear, clearer vision, fresh hope. And out of hope, progress.
author: Bruce Barton

text: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
author: Katherine Mansfield

text: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
author: Tony Robbins

text: We have to face the reality of climate change. It is arguably the biggest threat we are facing today.
author: William Hague

text: In too many instances, the march to globalization has also meant the marginalization of women and girls. And that must change.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: For an introvert his environment is himself and can never be subject to startling or unforeseen change.
author: Quentin Crisp

text: Remember, each one of us has the power to change the world. Just start thinking peace, and the message will spread quicker than you think.
author: Yoko Ono

text: It's better to get smart than to get mad. I try not to get so insulted that I will not take advantage of an opportunity to persuade people to change their minds.
author: John H. Johnson

text: News reports don't change the world. Only facts change it, and those have already happened when we get the news.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

text: In times of change learners inherit the earth while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: No change in musical style will survive unless it is accompanied by a change in clothing style. Rock is to dress up to.
author: Frank Zappa

text: We like to think about how smart we are. But I think talent as a writer is hard-wired in, it's all there, at least the basic elements of it. You can't change it any more than you can choose whether to be right handed or left handed.
author: Stephen King

text: I don't believe that if I came out as bisexual the world will change. But it's really important for people to be truthful about who they are and fight for equality. We need to help the world usher itself into the next phase.
author: Olivia Thirlby

text: For the past 33 years, I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: 'If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?' And whenever the answer has been 'No' for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
author: Steve Jobs

text: President Obama's version of America is a divided one - pitting us against each other based on our income level, gender, and social status. His policies have failed! We are not better off than we were 4 years ago, and no rhetoric, bumper sticker, or campaign ad can change that.
author: Mia Love

text: I'm one of those people who thinks that changing one's hair is the only part of the body that you can change at will.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: A conception not reducible to the small change of daily experience is like a currency not exchangeable for articles of consumption it is not a symbol, but a fraud.
author: George Santayana

text: It's good for everyone to understand that they are to love their enemies, simply because your enemies show you things about yourself you need to change. So in actuality enemies are friends in reverse.
author: Gary Busey

text: We should learn to accept that change is truly the only thing that's going on always, and learn to ride with it and enjoy it.
author: Alice Walker

text: Kids are a huge sacrifice they change everything - but I'm ready to work for things of greater importance than going out to meet someone for dinner at 10 o'clock at night.
author: Katherine Heigl

text: Change means movement. Movement means friction. Only in the frictionless vacuum of a nonexistent abstract world can movement or change occur without that abrasive friction of conflict.
author: Saul Alinsky

text: If we go on the way we have, the fault is our greed and if we are not willing to change, we will disappear from the face of the globe, to be replaced by the insect.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

text: I just like food too much, and I don't want to change. I spent so much of childhood trying to change, and I just got sick of it... I don't want to look like Britney Spears, I just don't want to. She's hideous.
author: Beth Ditto

text: It's quite nice to see that I didn't have to change who I was to reach two very different types of people.
author: Marc Jacobs

text: One of my favorite philosophical tenets is that people will agree with you only if they already agree with you. You do not change people's minds.
author: Frank Zappa

text: Geoengineering - the deliberate, large-scale manipulation of the earth's climate to offset global warming - is a nightmare fix for climate change.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: Many a revolution started with the actions of a few. Only 56 men signed the Declaration of Independence. A few hanging together can lead a nation to change.
author: Wynton Marsalis

text: I moved to New York last year and I love it. It's a huge change and I've always wanted to spend time there. It's like a more intense London, and everything's up a few notches. The lights are brighter, the pace is faster and the food's better.
author: Rachel Weisz

text: Fall is my favorite season in Los Angeles, watching the birds change color and fall from the trees.
author: David Letterman

text: I want to be able to look back and say, 'I've done everything I can, and I was successful.' I don't want to look back and say I should have done this or that. I'd like to change things for the younger generation of swimmers coming along.
author: Michael Phelps

text: It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible decision can be made any longer without taking into account not only the world as it is, but the world as it will be.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The hope and change the Democrats had in mind was nothing more than a retread of the failed and discredited socialist policies that have been the enemy of freedom for centuries all over the world. I fear America is teetering towards tyranny.
author: Jim DeMint

text: If you want to change attitudes, start with a change in behavior.
author: William Glasser

text: Making money is not gonna change anything about what I am, except I won't answer the door.
author: Abel Ferrara

text: When people align around shared political, social, economic or environmental values, and take collective action, thinking and behavior that compromises the lives of millions of people around the world can truly change.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: You're only as young as the last time you changed your mind.
author: Timothy Leary

text: When you blame others, you give up your power to change.
author: Robert Anthony

text: There was a great complexity to my father. He was a devoted family man. But, in the same breath, he simply was not suited to an anchored life. He should have been somebody who had a backpack, an old map, a bit of change in his pocket and that was it - roaming the world.
author: Christian Bale

text: Just because you liked something as a youngster doesn't mean you have to like it as an adult. You can change your taste a little bit on the sweets and things like that.
author: Mike Ditka

text: The truth is that we can learn to condition our minds, bodies, and emotions to link pain or pleasure to whatever we choose. By changing what we link pain and pleasure to, we will instantly change our behaviors.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Enjoying success requires the ability to adapt. Only by being open to change will you have a true opportunity to get the most from your talent.
author: Nolan Ryan

text: If we are to change our world view, images have to change. The artist now has a very important job to do. He's not a little peripheral figure entertaining rich people, he's really needed.
author: Vaclav Havel

text: I've seen firsthand that being president doesn't change who you are. It reveals who you are.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Satire doesn't effect change.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: Excellent firms don't believe in excellence - only in constant improvement and constant change.
author: Tom Peters

text: Revolution, n. In politics, an abrupt change in the form of misgovernment.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: A small group of thoughtful people could change the world. Indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

text: If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to. If you are not afraid of dying, there is nothing you cannot achieve.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The Chinese government wants me to say that for many centuries Tibet has been part of China. Even if I make that statement, many people would just laugh. And my statement will not change past history. History is history.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If the shoe doesn't fit, must we change the foot?
author: Gloria Steinem

text: Sometimes if you want to see a change for the better, you have to take things into your own hands.
author: Clint Eastwood

text: Sometimes you could be in an unhappy relationship you are very much in love with someone, but it's making you unhappy and you think things can change and you can work it out.
author: Vanessa Paradis

text: People can undergo a sudden change of thinking and loyalties under threat of death or intense social pressure and isolation from friends and family.
author: Keith Henson

text: We think that democracy can change a lot of things, but we're being fooled, because democracy is not the election. We've been taught that democracy is having elections. And it isn't. Elections are the most horrendous aspect of democracy. It's the most mundane, trivial, disappointing, dirty aspect.
author: Gael Garcia Bernal

text: It's a huge change for your body. You don't even want to look in the mirror after you've had a baby, because your stomach is just hanging there like a Shar-Pei.
author: Cindy Crawford

text: What I learned in jail is that I can't change. I can't live a different lifestyle-this is it. This is the life that they gave and this is the life that I made.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: One of the most important things that I did to turn my life around was to realize and to accept that from this minute, that's all we have. Everything that happened behind us we cannot change so you might as well look to the future.
author: Nick Carter

text: I just change with the times. I really don't have a say in what's going on. Music was here before me.
author: Snoop Dogg

text: Weep not that the world changes - did it keep a stable, changeless state, it were cause indeed to weep.
author: William C. Bryant

text: Your race and gender don't change, but you can choose to change your political affiliation at will.
author: John Podhoretz

text: It is more rewarding to watch money change the world than watch it accumulate.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: If you never change your mind, why have one?
author: Edward de Bono

text: I do like change. That's the one thing exciting about me.
author: Katherine Heigl

text: The fight is always the same within the Democratic Party, isn't it? The more things change, the more they stay the same.
author: Dee Dee Myers

text: The low points I had all helped make up my character, so I probably wouldn't want to do away with them because I like being flawed and I like having them help me grow and change and become better and stronger.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: Anyone who's lost someone to cancer will say this, that you have to struggle to try to remember the person before the diagnosis happened, because they really do change - as anyone would change.
author: Mindy Kaling

text: We used to think that revolutions are the cause of change. Actually it is the other way around: change prepares the ground for revolution.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: The most useless are those who never change through the years.
author: James M. Barrie

text: Don't manage - lead change before you have to.
author: Jack Welch

text: Wars of nations are fought to change maps. But wars of poverty are fought to map change.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Early in life I had to choose between honest arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose the former and have seen no reason to change.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: We have to struggle against the conservatives from all sides, not only the right-wingers, but also the left-wing conservatives who don't want to change anything.
author: Jacques Delors

text: Styles, like everything else, change. Style doesn't.
author: Linda Ellerbee

text: I don't think that a leader can control, to any great extent, his destiny. Very seldom can he step in and change the situation if the forces of history are running in another direction.
author: Richard M. Nixon

text: A lot of people get impatient with the pace of change.
author: James Levine

text: Favor comes because for a brief moment in the great space of human change and progress some general human purpose finds in him a satisfactory embodiment.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Most of what needs to be changed in the euro zone can be done without treaty changes. The demand for treaty change is as political as it is legal and I don't think it's going to happen soon.
author: Nick Clegg

text: I've had some movies that have been ridiculed, but that's OK with me. I don't feel that really defines me. Should I change who I am to be popular?
author: Kevin Costner

text: There is nothing so stable as change.
author: Bob Dylan

text: An Army is a collection of armed men obliged to obey one man. Every change in the rules which impairs the principle weakens the army.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

text: As you navigate through the rest of your life, be open to collaboration. Other people and other people's ideas are often better than your own. Find a group of people who challenge and inspire you, spend a lot of time with them, and it will change your life.
author: Amy Poehler

text: Cats don't like change without their consent.
author: Roger Caras

text: Doubt is an uneasy and dissatisfied state from which we struggle to free ourselves and pass into the state of belief while the latter is a calm and satisfactory state which we do not wish to avoid, or to change to a belief in anything else.
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

text: You cannot expect to achieve new goals or move beyond your present circumstances unless you change.
author: Les Brown

text: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
author: Robin Williams

text: People can cry much easier than they can change.
author: James A. Baldwin

text: I love street style, seeing how girls wear pieces and how their pair accessories with their outfit. How they pair shoes with a bag and go to day to night and change things up.
author: Maria Sharapova

text: Those who visit foreign nations, but associate only with their own country-men, change their climate, but not their customs. They see new meridians, but the same men and with heads as empty as their pockets, return home with traveled bodies, but untravelled minds.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: I change during the course of a day. I wake and I'm one person, and when I go to sleep I know for certain I'm somebody else.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Some say that I should settle down, go slower and not push so hard, so quickly for such transformational change. To them, I say that you misunderstand the size of the problems we face, the strength of the status quo and the urgency of the people's desire for change.
author: Eliot Spitzer

text: I have found there are four steps to change. 1. You must want it. 2. You must believe it. 3. You must live it. 4. You will become it.
author: Glenn Beck

text: A great revolution in just one single individual will help achieve a change in the destiny of a society and, further, will enable a change in the destiny of humankind.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

text: The '80s made up for all the abuse I took during the '70s. I outlived all my critics. By the time I retired, everybody saw me as a venerable institution. Things do change.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

text: Ever since the collapse of cap and trade legislation and the realization that President Obama is unlikely to ever utter the words 'climate change' in public again, much less use the bully pulpit to prepare the nation for the catastrophic risks of inaction, the movement has been in a funk.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: You don't change the course of history by turning the faces of portraits to the wall.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: I have accepted fear as a part of life - specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back.
author: Erica Jong

text: Human memory is a marvelous but fallacious instrument. The memories which lie within us are not carved in stone not only do they tend to become erased as the years go by, but often they change, or even increase by incorporating extraneous features.
author: Primo Levi

text: Goals allow you to control the direction of change in your favor.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Change is inevitable. Change is constant.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Success cannot come from standstill men. Methods change and men must change with them.
author: James Cash Penney

text: Everything will change. The only question is growing up or decaying.
author: Nikki Giovanni

text: Choose your corner, pick away at it carefully, intensely and to the best of your ability and that way you might change the world.
author: Charles Eames

text: There are two kinds of fools: those who can't change their opinions and those who won't.
author: Josh Billings

text: For having lived long, I have experienced many instances of being obliged, by better information or fuller consideration, to change opinions, even on important subjects, which I once thought right but found to be otherwise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Strong characters are brought out by change of situation, and gentle ones by permanence.
author: Jean Paul

text: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
author: Andy Warhol

text: The creative destruction that social media is currently unleashing will change more than technology or the leader board of the Fortune 100. It is driving a qualitative shift in the nature of relationships between brands and their customers.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: If a man like Malcolm X could change and repudiate racism, if I myself and other former Muslims can change, if young whites can change, then there is hope for America.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
author: Harriet Tubman

text: Men do change, and change comes like a little wind that ruffles the curtains at dawn, and it comes like the stealthy perfume of wildflowers hidden in the grass.
author: John Steinbeck

text: Worry is a useless mulling over of things we cannot change.
author: Peace Pilgrim

text: I never want to change so much that people can't recognize me.
author: Taylor Swift

text: I don't think I'm really open to having Washington change me.
author: Rand Paul

text: Anyone who thinks there's safety in numbers hasn't looked at the stock market pages.
author: Irene Peter

text: Look at all the buses now that want exact change, exact change. I figure if I give them exact change, they should take me exactly where I want to go.
author: George C. Wallace

text: Things don't have to change the world to be important.
author: Steve Jobs

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: If I have to change my lifestyle, I don't want to live.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

text: Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.
author: George Gurdjieff

text: As a kid I had buck teeth and braces and acne. I hated what I saw. I'm still not comfortable, but that's why I change and adapt the way I look.
author: Marilyn Manson

text: Everything can change at any moment, suddenly and forever.
author: Paul Auster

text: It's best to leap into something you know you love. You might change your mind later, but that is the privilege of youth.
author: Charles Kuralt

text: I always try to keep the circumstances in my life fresh. I like to change the physical environment I live in, change the people around me and try to experience things for the first time. I think that keeps one on their toes, creatively and spiritually.
author: Lenny Kravitz

text: I'm very comfortable with how I look. I always have been. I think I look pretty good. There's nothing I want to change. I'm pretty happy with what I've got.
author: Avril Lavigne

text: Normal social behavior requires that we be able to recognize identities in spite of change. Unless we can do so, there can be no human society as we know it.
author: Kenneth L. Pike

text: The faults of a superior person are like the sun and moon. They have their faults, and everyone sees them they change and everyone looks up to them.
author: Confucius

text: Christians are supposed not merely to endure change, nor even to profit by it, but to cause it.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

text: I have a resistance to change in things that I feel comfortable with and that I'm used to.
author: Dennis Quaid

text: One of the things I've always personally tried to stress with this band was to have some kind of visual aspect and to be consistent with it - like, not to change.
author: Peter Steele

text: Every daring attempt to make a great change in existing conditions, every lofty vision of new possibilities for the human race, has been labeled Utopian.
author: Emma Goldman

text: I do genuinely believe that the political system is not linear. When it reaches a tipping point fashioned by a critical mass of opinion, the slow pace of change we're used to will no longer be the norm. I see a lot of signs every day that we're moving closer and closer to that tipping point.
author: Al Gore

text: You do have to change things as warfare changes.
author: Charles Schumer

text: It is well for people who think to change their minds occasionally in order to keep them clean. For those who do not think, it is best at least to rearrange their prejudices once in a while.
author: Luther Burbank

text: I don't allow anybody to change me. I still walk outta my house in rollers and I take walks. I do not care what people think.
author: Britney Spears

text: Someday perhaps change will occur when times are ready for it instead of always when it is too late. Someday change will be accepted as life itself.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: I mean, I think we're put here on earth to make your own destiny, to begin with. I don't think there's anything you can do this way or that way to change anything.
author: Waylon Jennings

text: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.
author: Richard P. Feynman

text: Complainers change their complaints, but they never reduce the amount of time spent in complaining.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Most women set out to try to change a man, and when they have changed him they do not like him.
author: Marlene Dietrich

text: There has been a change in men's attitudes toward their clothes. Men are more aware of fashion they're not afraid of it.
author: Calvin Klein

text: It took me so many years to move out. I'm definitely a bit of a Peter Pan, reluctant to grow up. It all seemed really nice at home-why change it? Part of me would prefer not to have any responsibility whatsoever.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

text: The Bush-Cheney administration had betrayed some basic American values. So there was hunger for change.
author: Al Gore

text: All change is bad. But sometimes it has to be done.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: Being ready isn't enough you have to be prepared for a promotion or any other significant change.
author: Pat Riley

text: Don't change on me. Don't extort me unless you intend to do it forever.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: I learned to change my accent in England, your accent identifies you very strongly with a class, and I did not want to be held back.
author: Sting

text: We have got to change our ethics and our financial system and our whole way of understanding the world. It has to be a world in which people live rather than die a sustainable world. It could be great.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: Sometimes we look for those thunderous things to happen in our life for our lives to change or go in the other direction. We seek the miracle. We seek the parting of the seas, the moving of the mountains. But no, it's a quiet thing. At least for me it was.
author: Ben Vereen

text: No matter how many modern parts I do, people still refer to me as Mrs. Costume Drama. Fight Club is a studio pic, and I've done very few of those. I've got a feeling it's going to change things for me.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

text: It is proof of a base and low mind for one to wish to think with the masses or majority, merely because the majority is the majority. Truth does not change because it is, or is not, believed by a majority of the people.
author: Giordano Bruno

text: I wouldn't change a thing - except my bank balance.
author: Johnny Thunders

text: As life runs on, the road grows strange with faces new - and near the end. The milestones into headstones change, Neath every one a friend.
author: James Russell Lowell

text: Successful people recognize crisis as a time for change - from lesser to greater, smaller to bigger.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

text: I want to change things for the better, just like everybody else.
author: Henry Rollins

text: I wouldn't change anything. I've made mistakes, but thanks to those mistakes, I've learned.
author: Enrique Iglesias

text: On some campuses, change is effected through nonviolent or even violent means.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: Because primarily of the power of the Internet, people of modest means can band together and amass vast sums of money that can change the world for some public good if they all agree.
author: William J. Clinton

text: When you have that window of opportunity called a crisis, move as quickly as you can, get as much done as you can. There's a momentum for change that's very compelling.
author: Anne M. Mulcahy

text: I haven't got the slightest idea how to change people, but still I keep a long list of prospective candidates just in case I should ever figure it out.
author: David Sedaris

text: I ran for president in order to be able to try to change Washington D.C. from the inside. Our federal government is broken.
author: Herman Cain

text: Relentless, repetitive self talk is what changes our self-image.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Climate change is a global issue - from the point of view of the Earth's climate, a molecule of CO2 emitted in Bejing is the same as a molecule emitted in Sydney.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: Doing all we can to combat climate change comes with numerous benefits, from reducing pollution and associated health care costs to strengthening and diversifying the economy by shifting to renewable energy, among other measures.
author: David Suzuki

text: The spirit of democracy is not a mechanical thing to be adjusted by abolition of forms. It requires change of heart.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The greatest revolution in our generation is that of human beings, who by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

text: A visit to a cinema is a little outing in itself. It breaks the monotony of an afternoon or evening it gives a change from the surroundings of home, however pleasant.
author: Ivor Novello

text: I think happiness comes from self-acceptance. We all try different things, and we find some comfortable sense of who we are. We look at our parents and learn and grow and move on. We change.
author: Jamie Lee Curtis

text: The atmosphere seems to change once the sun goes down and the race fans get to watch a good show.
author: Dale Earnhardt

text: Things do not change we change.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: If you want to change the culture, you will have to start by changing the organization.
author: Mary Douglas

text: There are plenty of problems in the world, and doubtless climate change - or whatever the currently voguish phrase for it all is - certainly is one of them. But it's low on my list.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: Any change is resisted because bureaucrats have a vested interest in the chaos in which they exist.
author: Richard M. Nixon

text: I really think the Patriot Act violates our Constitution. It was, it is, an illegal act. The Congress, the Senate and the president cannot change the Constitution.
author: Peter Camejo

text: The democracy process provides for political and social change without violence.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

text: They say marriage will change you but it didn't change me. Being in love changed me.
author: R. Kelly

text: Climate change was a point of division between Obama and Republican rival Mitt Romney. The president declared climate change a global threat, acknowledged that the actions of humanity were deepening the crisis, and pledged to do something about it if elected.
author: Ron Fournier

text: I have to change a lot of things before I become a good marathon runner.
author: Haile Gebrselassie

text: Opinions alter, manners change, creeds rise and fall, but the moral laws are written on the table of eternity.
author: Lord Acton

text: Character isn't something you were born with and can't change, like your fingerprints. It's something you weren't born with and must take responsibility for forming.
author: Jim Rohn

text: When you are young and healthy, it never occurs to you that in a single second your whole life could change.
author: Annette Funicello

text: My point is that perceptual bias can affect nut jobs and scientists alike. If we hold too rigidly to what we think we know, we ignore or avoid evidence of anything that might change our mind.
author: Martha Beck

text: All non-incumbent campaigns promise hope and change, but Obama took the promise to a new level of absurdity. He suggested that a vote for him would literally transform the Earth.
author: John Podhoretz

text: Television is like the invention of indoor plumbing. It didn't change people's habits. It just kept them inside the house.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

text: Only idiots refuse to change their minds.
author: Brigitte Bardot

text: Characters do not change. Opinions alter, but characters are only developed.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: It is evident that skepticism, while it makes no actual change in man, always makes him feel better.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: All great change in America begins at the dinner table.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: I try to contrast life today is full of contrast... We have to change.
author: Gianni Versace

text: Pick up a rifle and you change instantly from a subject to a citizen.
author: Jeff Cooper

text: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
author: Jim Rohn

text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Excuses change nothing, but make everyone feel better.
author: Mason Cooley

text: No foreigner has a place asking another people, another country, to change their constitution.
author: Hamid Karzai

text: In a progressive country change is constant change is inevitable.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: If any man claims the Negro should be content... let him say he would willingly change the color of his skin and go to live in the Negro section of a large city. Then and only then has he a right to such a claim.
author: Robert Kennedy

text: The experience of being in space didn't change my perspective of myself or of the planet or of life. I had no spiritual experience.
author: Sally Ride

text: A sense of blessedness comes from a change of heart, not from more blessings.
author: Mason Cooley

text: One of the big questions in the climate change debate: Are humans any smarter than frogs in a pot? If you put a frog in a pot and slowly turn up the heat, it won't jump out. Instead, it will enjoy the nice warm bath until it is cooked to death. We humans seem to be doing pretty much the same thing.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: I don't think the human mind can comprehend the past and the future. They are both just illusions that can manipulate you into thinking theres some kind of change.
author: Bob Dylan

text: For the first time in my adult lifetime, I am really proud of my country. And not just because Barack has done well, but because I think people are hungry for change. And I have been desperate to see our country moving in that direction.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Effectively, change is almost impossible without industry-wide collaboration, cooperation and consensus.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: The personal things should be left out of platforms at conventions. You can argue yourself blue in the face, and you're not going to change each other's minds. It's a waste of your time and my time.
author: Barbara Bush

text: The way of the Creative works through change and transformation, so that each thing receives its true nature and destiny and comes into permanent accord with the Great Harmony: this is what furthers and what perseveres.
author: Alexander Pope

text: If you take different mythologies from different cultures, the names may change and the story lines may vary but there is always something in common.
author: Maynard James Keenan

text: You can love more than one person in your life, but things will be different. There'll be a different dynamic. Needs and desires change.
author: Francesca Annis

text: Too many people just eat to consume calories. Try dining for a change.
author: John Walters

text: The thing that lies at the foundation of positive change, the way I see it, is service to a fellow human being.
author: Lech Walesa

text: We always overestimate the change that will occur in the next two years and underestimate the change that will occur in the next ten. Don't let yourself be lulled into inaction.
author: Bill Gates

text: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: When you forgive, you in no way change the past - but you sure do change the future.
author: Bernard Meltzer

text: Since change is constant, you wonder if people crave death because it's the only way they can get anything really finished.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: I think change is possible, but only for individuals who were never truly gay in the first place and who have a strong personal motivation to recover their heterosexuality.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: We cannot change anything until we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses.
author: Carl Jung

text: My goal was never to just create a company. A lot of people misinterpret that, as if I don't care about revenue or profit or any of those things. But what not being just a company means to me is not being just that - building something that actually makes a really big change in the world.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: I was away from the front lines for a while this spring, living with other troops, and considerable fighting took place while I was gone. When I got ready to return to my old friends at the front I wondered if I would sense any change in them.
author: Ernie Pyle

text: The only way to change is to vote. People are responsible.
author: Paul Wellstone

text: If you change partners every time it gets tough or you get a little dissatisfied, then I don't think you get the richness that's available in a long-term relationship.
author: Jeff Bridges

text: Instead of focusing on that circumstances that you cannot change - focus strongly and powerfully on the circumstances that you can.
author: Joy Page

text: It is absolutely impossible to transcend the laws of nature. What can change in historically different circumstances is only the form in which these laws expose themselves.
author: Karl Marx

text: Among all the tests President Obama faced in his first term, his biggest failure was climate change.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
author: Harrison Ford

text: Brands must empower their community to be change agents in their own right. To that end, they need to take on a mentoring role. This means the brand provides the tools, techniques and strategies for their customers to become more effective marketers in achieving their own goals.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: One good teacher in a lifetime may sometimes change a delinquent into a solid citizen.
author: Philip Wylie

text: No real social change has ever been brought about without a revolution... revolution is but thought carried into action.
author: Emma Goldman

text: Change is not a destination, just as hope is not a strategy.
author: Rudy Giuliani

text: Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator. And change has its enemies.
author: Robert Kennedy

text: I shall not change my course because those who assume to be better than I desire it.
author: Victoria Woodhull

text: I want to test my maximum and see how much I can do. And I want to change the world of swimming.
author: Michael Phelps

text: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
author: Michael Jordan

text: No one is in control of your happiness but you therefore, you have the power to change anything about yourself or your life that you want to change.
author: Barbara de Angelis

text: I didn't come into politics to change the Labour Party. I came into politics to change the country.
author: Tony Blair

text: What we call progress is the exchange of one nuisance for another nuisance.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: I spent a lot of my life holding back my cries, and I want to change that because it's not good for me.
author: Shania Twain

text: Aside from my work, in my everyday private life, I'm not a very adventureous person. I don't look for change.
author: Namie Amuro

text: I think sometimes when children grow up, their parents grow up. Mine grew up with me. We coexist. I don't try to change them anymore, and I don't think they try to change me. We agree to disagree.
author: Katy Perry

text: There are those people who are in your corner no matter what, you can't do any wrong, even when you do wrong. And then there are those people that no matter what you do they are going to dislike you and that's not going to change.
author: Brett Favre

text: Change in all things is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: In science the important thing is to modify and change one's ideas as science advances.
author: Herbert Spencer

text: Dreams are the seeds of change. Nothing ever grows without a seed, and nothing ever changes without a dream.
author: Debby Boone

text: It is time to change our policy of appeasement toward the Palestinians, to strengthen our ties with the nation of Israel.
author: Rick Perry

text: Don't knock the weather nine-tenths of the people couldn't start a conversation if it didn't change once in a while.
author: Kin Hubbard

text: Close elections tend to break toward the challenger because undecided voters - having held out so long against the incumbent - are by nature looking for change.
author: Ron Fournier

text: One of the advantages of moving quickly is if you do something wrong you can change it. What technologies tend to do is they tend to make a lot of mistakes... but then we go back and aggressively attack those mistakes - and fix them. And you usually recover pretty quickly.
author: Marc Andreessen

text: What looks absolutely fabulous in rehearsal can fall flat in front of an audience. The audience dictates what you do or don't change.
author: Harvey Fierstein

text: There is the good and the bad, the great and the low, the just and the unjust. I swear to you that all that will never change.
author: Albert Camus

text: One expected growth, change without it, the world was less, the well of inspiration dried up, the muses fled.
author: Charles de Lint

text: Europe is dying. That is one of the unsayable truths of our time. We are undergoing the moral equivalent of climate change and no one is talking about it.
author: Jonathan Sacks

text: Heat of blood makes young people change their inclinations often, and habit makes old ones keep to theirs a great while.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
author: Sydney J. Harris

text: If you actually want to change your world, there is a better way of doing it than blowing yourself up.
author: Salman Rushdie

text: You change your life by changing your heart.
author: Max Lucado

text: I don't change. The things around me change.
author: Jeremy Renner

text: We are like a woman with a difficult pregnancy. We have to rebuild the social classes in Egypt, and we must change the way things were.
author: Naguib Mahfouz

text: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: Integrity is not a conditional word. It doesn't blow in the wind or change with the weather. It is your inner image of yourself, and if you look in there and see a man who won't cheat, then you know he never will.
author: John D. MacDonald

text: There is no such thing as liberty. You only change one sort of domination for another. All we can do is to choose our master.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly.
author: William James

text: I told you I'm not going to criticize my successor. I'll just tell you that there are people at Gitmo that will kill American people at a drop of a hat and I don't believe that persuasion isn't going to work. Therapy isn't going to cause terrorists to change their mind.
author: George W. Bush

text: Is there any wonder why we are in such big trouble? Any question why the people don't trust their government anymore, and demand a change?
author: Chris Christie

text: It's not the destination that matters. It's the change of scene.
author: Brian Eno

text: The signs of outstanding leadership appear primarily among the followers. Are the followers reaching their potential? Are they learning? Serving? Do they achieve the required results? Do they change with grace? Manage conflict?
author: Max de Pree

text: When you have a tough loss, go through it and agonize. I had one loss that I still want to change, but at the same time I realize it is an important part of who I am.
author: Andrew Shue

text: Folks, the most insidious part of this whole health care scheme is that all of these vast medical expenditures will become nothing more than government budget items. We individuals will no longer exist. The relationship between a government and citizen will change forever.
author: Rush Limbaugh

text: Change before you have to.
author: Jack Welch

text: Science arose from poetry... when times change the two can meet again on a higher level as friends.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: You have a dramatic portion of your television program and you treat it dramatically, and then you have a comedic portion of your program, and you treat it differently. Why do you change who are between the two pieces? You're the same person. Just go.
author: Nathan Fillion

text: Some people change when they think they're a star or something.
author: Paris Hilton

text: You have to come in and be that character when you walk into the room. That's what one of my first acting teachers taught me. You know, don't go in there being Jennifer and then expect to flip and change, because they're not going to have that imagination.
author: Jennifer Lopez

text: Which goes to show you, you can make all the laws you want, but you cannot change people's ways. If you must change them, you have to understand that it will take a long time.
author: Miriam Makeba

text: It is in the mind and the heart where we meet. It's not the body-the body will change.
author: Amber Valletta

text: I think the tiniest little thing can change the course of your day, which can change the course of your year, which can change who you are.
author: Taylor Swift

text: Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks.
author: Doug Larson

text: My greatest challenge has been to change the mindset of people. Mindsets play strange tricks on us. We see things the way our minds have instructed our eyes to see.
author: Muhammad Yunus

text: The damage that climate change is causing and that will get worse if we fail to act goes beyond the hundreds of thousands of lives, homes and businesses lost, ecosystems destroyed, species driven to extinction, infrastructure smashed and people inconvenienced.
author: David Suzuki

text: Every great and deep difficulty bears in itself its own solution. It forces us to change our thinking in order to find it.
author: Niels Bohr

text: The world will change for the better when people decide they are sick and tired of being sick and tired of the way the world is, and decide to change themselves.
author: Sydney Madwed

text: Things alter for the worse spontaneously, if they be not altered for the better designedly.
author: Francis Bacon

text: In Britain, like most of the developed world, stem-cell research is regarded as a great opportunity. America will be left behind if it doesn't change policy.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
author: Charles Kettering

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: When you lead change, sometimes you get arrows in your back. I mean, that's just the way the real world is.
author: Carly Fiorina

text: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
author: Joel A. Barker

text: It is not necessary to change. Survival is not mandatory.
author: W. Edwards Deming

text: There's no reason to change what you are, but if you're not being you, then you need to acknowledge that.
author: Marilyn Manson

text: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Well... I had braces and I had to wear headgear! I loved my braces, actually. For me, they were like a piece of jewelry! Instead of the silver or pewter I had gold braces. It was so much fun, I loved them. I got to change the colors and stuff and I had the rubber bands.
author: Jordin Sparks

text: The new dynamics between brands and consumers, driven by social media, are proving to be a powerful impetus for change.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything... or nothing.
author: Nancy Astor

text: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one's energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience. To stop means simply to die. The eternal mistake of mankind is to set up an attainable ideal.
author: Aleister Crowley

text: Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Change is vital, improvement the logical form of change.
author: James Cash Penney

text: Without change, something sleeps inside us, and seldom awakens. The sleeper must awaken.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Whether you're winning or losing, it is important to always be yourself. You can't change because of the circumstances around you.
author: Cotton Fitzsimmons

text: Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You can't move so fast that you try to change the mores faster than people can accept it. That doesn't mean you do nothing, but it means that you do the things that need to be done according to priority.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You know who is against democracy in the Middle East? The husbands. They got used to their way of life. Now, the traditional way of life must change. Everybody must change. If you don't give equal rights to women, you can't progress.
author: Shimon Peres

text: Every day I'm thinking about change.
author: Miuccia Prada

text: I can be almost terminally grief-stricken because things are so dire, but at the same time, there's a real lightheartedness about just the recoverability of life, of how things change, how they're not the same, ever again.
author: Alice Walker

text: There's no sense in going to a tournament if you don't believe that you can win it. And that is the belief I have always had. And that is not going to change.
author: Tiger Woods

text: When you are through changing, you are through.
author: Bruce Barton

text: Change is such hard work.
author: Billy Crystal

text: Even before he came to power in 1997, Gordon Brown promised to change the accounts to parliament from simple litanies of cash in and cash out, to a more commercial system that took notice of the public property the departments were using. This system is known as resource accounting.
author: James Buchan

text: And it's absolutely true that male sexual behaviour and female responses to male demands change a lot when they start communicating - and the levels of the communication that I've seen on the ground in very, very poor areas are so high and I think why don't we have that here?
author: Emma Thompson

text: We have a powerful potential in out youth, and we must have the courage to change old ideas and practices so that we may direct their power toward good ends.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

text: Americans have so far put up with inequality because they felt they could change their status. They didn't mind others being rich, as long as they had a path to move up as well. The American Dream is all about social mobility in a sense - the idea that anyone can make it.
author: Fareed Zakaria

text: A leopard does not change his spots, or change his feeling that spots are rather a credit.
author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

text: Obviously comedic styles do change.
author: Larry David

text: In one century, we've added 28 years to our average life span - a change so rapid that our brains couldn't possibly have evolved to accommodate it.
author: Martha Beck

text: I didn't want to go out and change anything. I just wanted to make the music that was part of my background, which was rock and blues and hip-hop.
author: Kid Rock

text: Change yourself and your work will seem different.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Happy he who learns to bear what he cannot change.
author: Friedrich Schiller

text: I don't think people change. I think they definitely mature. But I think the essence of what I am today is the same as when I was five years old. It's just maturity. I've become a healthier, fuller expression of that essence.
author: Ricky Williams

text: The only change I can really see is that I don't have to shop for pants in stores anymore.
author: Larry David

text: Change is one of my favourite words.
author: Carol Vorderman

text: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Ignorance is always afraid of change.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Let the great world spin for ever down the ringing grooves of change.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: When it becomes more difficult to suffer than to change... you will change.
author: Robert Anthony

text: Artists to my mind are the real architects of change, and not the political legislators who implement change after the fact.
author: William S. Burroughs

text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

text: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.
author: Irene Peter

text: If you don't change, then what's the point of anything happening to you?
author: Doug Coupland

text: Hope and change? We're not doing that anymore. They're doing attack and blame. And so, I just think people are going to see through this. They want real leadership. They want us to get this country on the right track.
author: Paul Ryan

text: You know, Motorcycle Diaries has no incredible stories, no sudden plot twists, it doesn't play that way. It's about recognizing that instance of change and embracing it.
author: Gael Garcia Bernal

text: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
author: Robert Frost

text: People change and forget to tell each other.
author: Lillian Hellman

text: I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.
author: Tony Robbins

text: I hope to bring much more attention to important issues and change for issues and practices that are harming animals.
author: Kesha

text: Exploiting people's emotions of fear, envy and anxiety is not hope, it's not change, it's partisanship. We don't need partisanship. We don't need demagoguery, we need solutions.
author: Paul Ryan

text: If you are interested enough in the climate crisis to read this post, you probably know that 2 degrees Centigrade of warming (or 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit) is the widely acknowledged threshold for "dangerous" climate change.
author: Jeff Goodell

text: I take sounds and change them into words.
author: Brian Eno

text: Pop culture is a reflection of social change, not a cause of social change.
author: John Podhoretz

text: I came to poetry through the urgent need to denounce injustice, exploitation, humiliation. I know that's not enough to change the world. But to remain silent would have been a kind of intolerable complicity.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

text: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character, would you slow down? Or speed up?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: I have noticed even people who claim everything is predestined, and that we can do nothing to change it, look before they cross the road.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
author: Thomas Hardy

text: Because things are the way they are, things will not stay the way they are.
author: Bertolt Brecht

text: Reconciliation requires changes of heart and spirit, as well as social and economic change. It requires symbolic as well as practical action.
author: Malcolm Fraser

text: If you believe that feeling bad or worrying long enough will change a past or future event, then you are residing on another planet with a different reality system.
author: William James

text: I don't think anything changes until ideas change. The usual American viewpoint is to believe that something is wrong with the person.
author: James Hillman

text: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: That sort of half sigh, which, accompanied by two or three slight nods of the head, is pity's small change in general society.
author: Charles Dickens

text: One-third of Americans have already been forced to change their lifestyle because their disposable income is gone. A guy can't go to the corner bar after a rough day at work to have a beer, that's gone to oil!
author: Terry McAuliffe

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Believe it or not, lots of people change their majors and abandon their dreams just to avoid a couple of math classes in college.
author: Danica McKellar

text: I didn't think that college math was for me. I didn't think I'd be able to hack it. And that perception of math not being for girls, not being for girls who see themselves as socially well adjusted has got to change.
author: Danica McKellar

text: As a rock star, I have two instincts, I want to have fun, and I want to change the world. I have a chance to do both.
author: Bono

text: Redemption just means you just make a change in your life and you try to do right, versus what you were doing, which was wrong.
author: Ice T

text: If there's specific resistance to women making movies, I just choose to ignore that as an obstacle for two reasons: I can't change my gender, and I refuse to stop making movies.
author: Kathryn Bigelow

text: Change brings opportunities. On the other hand, change can be confusing.
author: Michael Porter

text: The Roman Catholic Church isn't going to change its theologies.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: To change what you get you must change who you are.
author: Vernon Howard

text: It is not strange... to mistake change for progress.
author: Millard Fillmore

text: I don't think you can work on feelings in politics, apart from anything else, political change can come very unexpectedly, sometimes overnight when you least expect it.
